page.title: 19Dairy Farmer in the Wolfords
page.content: My day starts between 4:30am and 5:30am depending on the time of year, winter being the earlier start. During the winter months the next part of the day is always busy, looking to the needs of the cows which are mostly housed between November and April. In the summer however, the middle part of the day is far more relaxed and there is a chance to catch up on all the extra jobs which tend to build up on a dairy farm. I milk again in the afternoon around 4pm and I'm usually finished at about 7pm although the day does not always finish then. I couldn't imagine myself doing any other job and although much of dairy farming is a chore, I find it a very satisfying way of life.
